item.title: Git Subtree to create branches from subfolder
item.description: This post is about using git subtree merge to have a branch that is a subset of another branch. Github will be a use case and act as a way to illustrate this feature, there are probably other ways to accomplish the same result.

item.title: Virtualenvwrapper plugins for gems and npms
item.description: In a previous post, we've seen how to modify your activate script to keep inside a virtualenv the packages from Node and Ruby called gems and npms. I find useful to be able to try gems or npms inside a virtualenv without contaminate your setup.

item.title: Handling Go workspace with direnv
item.description: When I started to do some Go I quickly hit my first hurdle: The Go Workspace. The go tool is designed to work with code maintained in public repositories using the FQDN and path as a kind of namespace and package name. Eg: github.com/rach/project-x, where github.com/rach is a kind of namespace enforce by a directory structure and project-x is the package name also enforce by directory structure.
